title: INVENTORY / COCKATOO
description: From A to Zrieek! Guide to a Well-Behaved Cockatoo. After you have bought it. (Helen)

dialogueTree.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "A cockatoo is a parrot with an erec..."
dialogueTree.text: A cockatoo is a parrot with an erectile crest, found on the Semenine islands and in southern Face-Ã -la-Mer. Known for their intelligence and general precociousness, cockatoos are popular birds in aviculture; however, they often exhibit various behavioural issues.

links.title: You: "Okay. What more?"
links.text: Okay. What more?

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "This book talks about the delicate..."
links.text: This book talks about the delicate nature of 'toos, as well as introducing some of the most popular species among the bird enthusiasts: the funeral cockatoo, the Major Majestic cockatoo, and the most common bang-bang cockatoo. It's colourfully illustrated.

links.title: You: "Alright, what problems do these bir..."
links.text: Alright, what problems do these birds have?

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "Where to even begin? All cockatoos..."
links.text: Where to even begin? All cockatoos are known for their needy natures, requiring attention for at least two full hours a day. They love to talk, and have been described as 'loveable clowns who just don't know how to wrap up'.

links.title: You: "I could handle that... It would be..."
links.text: I could handle that... It would be nice to have someone to talk to when feeling lonely.

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "Pet owners also report moodiness, l..."
links.text: Pet owners also report moodiness, loudness and hostility as reoccurring issues. If left unsatisfied cockatoos may scream non-stop, pluck their feathers or become aggressive.

links.title: You: "Right. That's pretty bad. Anything..."
links.text: Right. That's pretty bad. Anything else?

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "It is not recommended to get a cock..."
links.text: It is not recommended to get a cockatoo if you're not able to cook them food every day. And give them the full care that they need. These birds will never understand that you have a life of your own.

links.title: You: "Who would ever want a chatty compan..."
links.text: Who would ever want a chatty companion?! I want someone who knows how to *listen*.

links.title: You: "Yes, but there has to be something..."
links.text: Yes, but there has to be something *great* about cockatoos as well.

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "You're right, cockatoos are magnifi..."
links.text: You're right, cockatoos are magnificent creatures. They love to perform, cuddle and show off, and will even scream for *fun* -- often as loud as up to *135* decibels!

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Ouch. That must hurt."
links.text: Ouch. That must hurt.

links.title: Logic: "Not great for the neighbours."
links.text: Not great for the neighbours.

links.title: Drama: "Performing? Yesss, birdie!"
links.text: Performing? Yesss, birdie!

links.title: You: "Read about the funeral cockatoo."
links.text: Read about the funeral cockatoo.

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "This is a yellow-tailed black cocka..."
links.text: This is a yellow-tailed black cockatoo. Its specific name *Psittacus funereus* relates to its dark and sombre plumage. This bird looks as if dressed for a funeral, 24/7. There is something indisputably ominous about it.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Cool."
links.text: Cool.

links.title: You: "Read about the Major Majestic cocka..."
links.text: Read about the Major Majestic cockatoo.

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "Perhaps the most *impressive* of al..."
links.text: Perhaps the most *impressive* of all the species, the endangered Major Majestic cockatoo is often described as the most flamboyant bird in the jungle, its pink-coloured wings and flowing crest embellishing its proud and *bumptious* nature.

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "In the words of poet-explorer Sir J..."
links.text: In the words of poet-explorer Sir James Fournier: "Few birds more enliven the monotonous hues of the verdant forest than this big, bold and beautiful species."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "It must be glorious to behold. Dark..."
links.text: It must be glorious to behold. Dark pink and snow white.

links.title: You: "Read about the most common bang-ban..."
links.text: Read about the most common bang-bang cockatoo.

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "Despite its *banging* name, the ban..."
links.text: Despite its *banging* name, the bang-bang cockatoo is actually the shyest of the species. Common in almost all Semenese forests, as well as zoos and homes all over the world, its plumage is mainly grey and white. The Semenese name *bang-bang* is thought to be of onomatopoeic origins.

links.title: Half Light: "The *bang* is for all the scary thi..."
links.text: The *bang* is for all the scary things in the world... that may happen at any time.

links.title: You: "Honestly, this bird does sound a bi..."
links.text: Honestly, this bird does sound a bit like me...

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "Yes, but all those cockatoo species..."
links.text: Yes, but all those cockatoo species are so different! Which one are you?

links.title: You: "The grey and common bang-bang, that..."
links.text: The grey and common bang-bang, that's me.

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "You're right, you're the mediocrity..."
links.text: You're right, you're the mediocrity embodied. This unsung bird belongs on your heraldry!

links.title: You: "Only the funeral cockatoo in its da..."
links.text: Only the funeral cockatoo in its darkness can truly grasp the depths of my doom-laden soul.

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "You're right, you're *Psittacus fun..."
links.text: You're right, you're *Psittacus funereus* embodied. This ominous bird belongs on your heraldry!

links.title: You: "Isn't that obvious?! Major Majestic..."
links.text: Isn't that obvious?! Major Majestic, here I come!

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "You're right, you're majesty embodi..."
links.text: You're right, you're majesty embodied. This big beautiful bird belongs on your heraldry!

links.title: You: "But what if I am just a *fuckupatoo..."
links.text: But what if I am just a *fuckupatoo* -- a fuck-up *and* a cockatoo?!

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "You're right, you're a fuckatoo emb..."
links.text: You're right, you're a fuckatoo embodied. This sorry-ass bird belongs on your heraldry! It probably doesn't even have feathers and only screams.

links.title: You: "I have to take some time to think a..."
links.text: I have to take some time to think about it.

links.title: From A to Zrieek! A Guide To a Well-Behaved Cockatoo: "Understandable. Choosing your heral..."
links.text: Understandable. Choosing your heraldic bird isn't a trivial question.

links.title: You: "[Put the book away.]"
links.text: [Put the book away.]
